Interface_name: HTTP based on express in javascript
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a reusable HTTP server class in JavaScript using the Express framework that can handle various HTTP methods, middleware configuration, and file uploads.

Class Description: The HTTPServer class encapsulates an Express application with configurable routes, middleware, and file upload capabilities. It provides methods to start/stop the server and add route handlers for different HTTP methods.

Attributes:
- app: [Object] - The Express application instance
- port: [Number] - The port number the server listens on
- server: [Object|null] - The HTTP server instance (null before starting)

Methods:
- constructor(port) -> [HTTPServer] - Initializes the Express app with middleware and file upload handling
- start() -> [Promise] - Starts the server on the specified port
- stop() -> [void] - Stops the server if running
- addRoute(method, path, handler) -> [void] - Adds a route handler for a specific HTTP method
- get(path, handler) -> [void] - Adds a GET route handler
- post(path, handler) -> [void] - Adds a POST route handler
- put(path, handler) -> [void] - Adds a PUT route handler
- delete(path, handler) -> [void] - Adds a DELETE route handler
- patch(path, handler) -> [void] - Adds a PATCH route handler
- options(path, handler) -> [void] - Adds an OPTIONS route handler
- trace(path, handler) -> [void] - Adds a TRACE route handler
- head(path, handler) -> [void] - Adds a HEAD route handler
